senses.de: To discuss something with someone to reach an agreement
senses.ex: The company refused to negotiate with the union.

Tips.title: Discussion Flow
Tips.description: Negotiating implies a back-and-forth exchange, often to find a middle ground.
Tips.example: We need to negotiate our terms carefully to benefit both parties.

Tips.title: Power Dynamics
Tips.description: The ability to negotiate can depend on the balance of power between parties.
Tips.example: As a new employee, she found it hard to negotiate her salary.

Tips.title: Resolution Goal
Tips.description: The main goal of negotiating is to resolve differences and reach an agreement.
Tips.example: We negotiated all night to resolve the conflict.

senses.de: To move in a clever way around something or someone that could cause problems for you
senses.ex: He managed to negotiate his way through the crowd.

Tips.title: Strategic Movement
Tips.description: Negotiate can imply careful planning to move through challenging situations.
Tips.example: She negotiated the busy streets with ease.

Tips.title: Clever Adaptation
Tips.description: Using 'negotiate' in this way shows adaptability in tricky circumstances.
Tips.example: He negotiated the complex rules of the game quickly.

senses.de: To arrange for something to happen after discussions

Tips.title: Agreement Crafting
Tips.description: In legal terms, negotiate focuses on formally arranging terms and conditions.
Tips.example: The lawyers negotiated the terms before drafting the contract.

Tips.title: Plan Creation
Tips.description: Negotiate can mean to collaboratively come up with a detailed plan or strategy.
Tips.example: We negotiated a repayment plan that suited both sides.

senses.de: To successfully get past or through a difficult part or period
senses.ex: We had several difficulties to negotiate before we could set up the project.

Tips.title: Problem Handling
Tips.description: Using 'negotiate' this way implies active efforts to solve challenges.
Tips.example: He negotiated every hurdle on the course meticulously.

Tips.title: Stressful Situations
Tips.description: Negotiating can involve managing stressful periods or complex parts of a task.
Tips.example: The team had to negotiate a crucial phase of the project.

Agree.wordDefinition:
Agree means to say yes or accept someone else's idea or proposal without discussion or argument. For example, if someone asks if you want to go to the movies, and you say yes, you've agreed to the idea without further discussion.

Negotiate means to discuss and come to a mutual agreement or compromise with another person or party. For example, if you were trying to buy a used car, you would negotiate the price with the seller, discussing and coming to an agreed-upon price that is beneficial to both parties.

Agree means to accept an idea without debate, while negotiate means to engage in discussion and compromise to reach an agreement.

Bargain.wordDefinition:
Bargain refers to getting something at a lower price than what is being asked for or selling something at a higher price than what it is worth.

To summarize, bargain describes obtaining a good deal on a product while negotiate describes making a deal or agreement with another party.

Broker.wordDefinition:
A broker is a person or company who acts as a middleman between two parties to facilitate a transaction, such as buying or selling a property or financial investment.

Negotiate refers to the act of discussing and reaching a mutual agreement between two parties. It involves exchanging ideas and finding a solution that works for both parties without necessarily involving a third-party broker.

A broker helps parties complete a transaction while negotiating involves parties coming to a mutual agreement without a middleman involved.

Compromise.wordDefinition:
Compromise is when two or more people agree to give up some of what they want in order to reach a solution that everyone can live with.

It's like meeting in the middle. For example, if two friends are deciding what to do together and one suggests going to the movies and the other suggests going to the beach, they might compromise by going to a nearby lake instead.

However, compromise is more focused on finding a solution that meets everyone's needs, while negotiate is focused on trying to get the best outcome for yourself while still working with others.

Confer.wordDefinition:
The main difference between the words confer and negotiate is that confer refers to discussing something with someone in order to make a decision, while negotiate refers to discussing and reaching an agreement or compromise with someone.

Confer is applicable in situations where a group of people need to discuss or exchange ideas before making a decision. For example, a board of directors may confer about the direction of a company before making a decision.

Confer is about discussing and coming to a decision, while negotiate is about discussing and coming to an agreement or compromise.

Discuss.wordDefinition:
Discuss means to talk about a topic or issue in order to share thoughts or ideas. It is a general term used for conversations where people exchange their views and reach a common understanding.

To simplify it for a 15-year-old, discussing something means talking about it while negotiating means talking about it to come up with a decision that both parties agree on.

'Discussions' are used when people need to exchange their opinions, while 'negotiations' come into play when people are trying to finalize a deal or reach an agreement.

Haggle.wordDefinition:
Haggle and negotiate both mean to discuss terms and come to an agreement, but there are some differences in their usage.

Haggle is typically used when discussing the details of a purchase or price with a seller or vendor. It often involves back-and-forth bargaining and trying to get the best deal possible.

For example, you might haggle with a salesperson over the price of a car or at a flea market over the cost of a piece of art.

Haggle is more specific to price-related discussions with a seller, while negotiate can be used in a wider variety of situations where two parties are trying to reach an agreement.

Mediate.wordDefinition:
Both mediate and negotiate refer to resolving a disagreement between two parties, but there is a subtle difference.

Mediation involves a third party who intervenes to help the two parties talk to each other and reach an agreement on their own.

The mediator does not make decisions for them, but rather facilitates communication and compromise. Mediation is generally used when two parties have a difficult time coming to an agreement on their own and need a neutral person to assist them.

Negotiation is more confrontational than mediation, but the parties have more control over the outcome. Negotiation is often used when the parties are more equal in power and can discuss directly with each other.

In summary, mediation involves a third party who helps two parties communicate and come to an agreement, while negotiation involves a direct conversation between the two parties to find a resolution.

Resolve.wordDefinition:
Resolve means to find a solution to a problem or conflict.

It can be used in a wider range of situations, not necessarily in a negotiation context. For example, you can resolve a technical issue on your computer, a tension between two friends, or a personal challenge you are facing.

In summary, while negotiation refers to a specific process of reaching an agreement with others, resolving refers to finding a way to overcome a problem or obstacle, either with or without the involvement of others.

Settle.wordDefinition:
Settle means to resolve or come to a final decision about something. It is applicable when the decision has already been made, and there is no more negotiation needed.

For example, a lawsuit may be settled out of court with a monetary agreement between the parties involved.

Negotiate is about reaching an agreement, while settle is about making a final decision.

Transact.wordDefinition:
Transact means to carry out a business deal. It typically involves a straightforward exchange of goods or services for money.

Transact is applicable when both parties have agreed on the terms of the deal and are ready to exchange goods or services for money.

quotes.Text: Basically, managing is about influencing action. Managing is about helping organizations and units to get things done, which means action. Sometimes, managers manage actions directly. They fight fires. They manage projects. They negotiate contracts.
quotes.Title: Canadian Businessman
quotes.Name: Henry Mintzberg

quotes.Text: Humanity should question itself, once more, about the absurd and always unfair phenomenon of war, on whose stage of death and pain only remain standing the negotiating table that could and should have prevented it.
quotes.Title: Polish Saint
quotes.Name: Pope John Paul II

quotes.Text: When I was a child it was very clear what I was allowed to see and what I was not allowed to see and there was no discussion or option or negotiation. Whatever my mom said, that's what went down.
quotes.Title: Cuban Actor
quotes.Name: Yul Vazquez

quotes.Text: It's a very big world with some very big characters. And, boy, do you have to be able to stand up for yourself when you walk into a working men's club and negotiate a loan.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Judith McKenna

quotes.Text: When I go on vacation, I leave my house in total order: bills paid, garbage out, no milk in the refrigerator, mail done so that I can better negotiate what will await me.
quotes.Title: American Lawyer
quotes.Name: Judy Sheindlin

quotes.Text: If you come to a negotiation table saying you have the final truth, that you know nothing but the truth and that is final, you will get nothing.
quotes.Title: Finnish Politician
quotes.Name: Harri Holkeri

quotes.Text: There's a way of negotiating how you portray your private life publicly that I've never had the skill to do.
quotes.Title: English Actor
quotes.Name: Gina McKee

quotes.Text: There's no road map on how to raise a family: it's always an enormous negotiation.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Meryl Streep

quotes.Text: I support negotiating authority to lower prescription drug prices.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Jan Schakowsky

quotes.Text: You can only end a negotiation for peace if you begin it.
quotes.Title: Israeli Leader
quotes.Name: Benjamin Netanyahu
